entry.title: Book: The Dragonet Prophecy, by Tui T. Sutherland (2012) (2)
entry.content:
Book: The Dragonet Prophecy, by Tui T. Sutherland (2012) (2)20171124
I finished this today. It was okay. It is so clearly written for a
young kid that doesn't have the patience to see a lot of
development. Very "tell" and not "show". I was surprised at how
bloody it was though.
  • Books
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (10)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (10)20171123
I got the ship and started to go towards the Western
continent. When I was younger, I loved the freedom of getting
ships/etc in games, because I would explore all over the
place. Nowadays, it frustrates me because I feel like there's a
bunch of random stuff that I should get to be the best at the
game, but it is frustratingly all over the place in weird
corners. Then, of course, you can't really go everywhere at this
point in the game, so there's all sorts of islands/continents with
too-high-cliffs that you can't get on to. I just want to move on
and play the game more but it's not obvious where to go.

Total time: 14:47
  • Video Games
  • Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King
  • 3DS
  • 2017

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (9)20171122
I made it to the castle that the king is from. It is very
complicated, so I have a lot of places that I need to explore
still inside of it, but I just got to the library (the
destination.) I am very close to getting some exciting skills on
my characters.

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (7)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (7)20171120
I got the quest to wait at night on top of the hill, but it is a
long way to get there, so it is taking a while, especially because
Jessica died once, so I had to Zoom back to the chapel to heal
up. This game is a lot of fun... a little mindless, but lots of
fun.

Total time: 8:41

entry.title: Movie: Murder on the Orient Express, starring Kenneth Branagh (2017)
entry.content:
Movie: Murder on the Orient Express, starring Kenneth Branagh (2017)20171117
This was well produced and interesting, although nothing was
particularly special about it. I disliked that the murder was
justified in the end and that it would have been impossible for the
audience to figure it out, but that's her style. It was fun,
though, because we watched it with *REDACTED*'s book group.
  • Movies
  • 2017

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (3)20171116
I played through most of the scenes up to when (I assume) you get
Jessica. The conversations in the town were fun and it was neat to
see Dhoulmagus, rather than just having him talked about. I am
very nervous about specializing too much in one weapon, but I feel
like that will be better than spreading my characters too thin.

Total time: 3:55

  • Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King
  • 3DS
  • 2017

entry.title: Movie: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets, starring Dane DeHaan (2017)
entry.content:
Movie: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets, starring Dane DeHaan (2017)20171116
This was such a wild and beautiful movie. I really loved the
opening sequence that showed time passing and the station
growing. The world was just so exotic and far more creative than
most other scifi. The actual story and plot was just okay and I
though that Rihanna's character was really stupid and it was
especially not impactful that she died. I thought that Laureline
was very beautiful, but there was basically no chemistry between
the actors. It was cute to have them chat and get together.
  • Movies
  • 2017

entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest 8: Journey of the Cursed King (3DS, 2017) (2)20171115
I completed the first quest and did a bunch of fun grinding in the
process. It is so fun to fight monsters! I am very nervous I won't
be able to unlock every skill in the game because I have so few
and I'm already level 10.

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 10 - Fire and Blood (4)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 10 - Fire and Blood (4)20171113
This episode is strange because it is all just fallout and it
doesn't seem that important within the episode, but everything
has a huge consequence: Bran's dream foreshadows his whole story;
Jaime's wallowing in prison is step one in his journey of
redemption; Robb's acceptance of being the King in the North will
lead to his death; Tyrion will finally grow up as the Hand of the
King; Arya is going on a totally different path now; Sansa will
start being tortured by man after man; Jon has left the South
behind; and Dany has DRAGONS!
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 18 - Booster
entry.content:
Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 18 - Booster20171107
I enjoyed the continued story of Clark being a doof. Booster Gold
is such a funny character. I thought Blue Beetle wasn't developed
enough.
  • TV Shows
  • Smallville

entry.title: Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 19 - Dominion
entry.content:
Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 19 - Dominion20171107
This was a really stupid episode and just an excuse to bring Zod
in. The only good part was how Lois reacted given that he had
been gone for weeks. That was really cool.
  • TV Shows
  • Smallville

entry.title: Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 20 - Prophecy
entry.content:
Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 20 - Prophecy20171107
This was a very fun episode, especially because Kara was around
and the two leads got to see what it was like in the others'
shoes. I didn't like Lois' reaction, but I can see why it is
dramatically useful. The fake table of villains sucked.
  • TV Shows
  • Smallville

entry.title: Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 21 - Finale
entry.content:
Smallville - Season 10 - Episode 21 - Finale20171107
There were parts of this that were great, like the romancey stuff
at the start of the episode. On the other hand, there were lame
parts like how old people were trotted out just for fan
service. I would have liked to see some more of Superman, but
I've learned to be let down by the show. It was a nice finish,
but I'm very glad it is over. The framing of Chloe reading to her
son was fun.
  • TV Shows
  • Smallville

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 9 - Baelor (4)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 9 - Baelor (4)20171106
Ned's words are so amazing, "You think I consider my life a
valuable thing?" and "I learned to die a long time ago." Oh man,
I nearly cried. The conversation between Jon and Aemon to also be
pretty awesome too. I was also really impressed by the great
scenes between Bronn and Tyrion. It is amazing how much in Dany's
life started happening just because of a bunch of accidents.

Ned Stark: ``You think my life is some precious thing to me? That
I would trade my honour for a few more years of...of what? You
grew up with actors, you learned their craft and you learnt it
well. But I grew up with soldiers. I learned how to die a long
time ago.''

It was great too how Arya and Yoren interacted.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones
